column4: I had unallocated space on my drive, so I used a live boot to resize my /home partition form 10 to 30gigs, and now it shows it as 30 gigs, but 26gigs full already, I still have the same free space as before. Any ideas?
are you using VLM?
I'm not sure what that means :(
ok, you had to make partitions when installing ubuntu... did you make them automatically or manually? Also, are you dual booting with windows?
Manually, and yes, windows is on a second harddrive than linux, but I dual boot
ok, did u make just one big partition or did you make a /boot, swap and ext3 partition/s?
I have a boot, a swap, a root dir, and a /home partition
ok, did u install windows first or ubuntu?
Windows I'm pretty sure
pretty  sure? lol...
It's been a long time since I did a fresh install, but windows was first
can you type 'df -h' and paste the output on http://pastebin.ca
http://pastebin.ca/1498992
nothing looks wrong there
Well, whe nI open up partition editor, my /hom is 29.9 gigs, not 9..
yes, because you're not looking at your actual /home partition, you're looking at the LVM that CONTAINS your logical /home partition.
if you could paste a screenshot of your partition manager i could confirm
first what partition manager are you using?
GParted 0.4.3
k
paste to http://imagebin.ca
http://imagebin.ca/view/mkDOAvDx.html
http://imagebin.ca/view/mkDOAvDx.html
